items.message: River levels remain higher than normal but are now falling. Flooding may affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly low-lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Drier conditions are forecast this week, and conditions will continue to improve. We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue further alerts and warnings if required. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water and consider activating any flood protection products you may have. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 18/11/2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message:
Areas most at risk are Church Laneham to Rampton Road. 

No further rain is forecast, however river levels at Torksey Gauge are continuing to rise and will remain high until Thursday, 20/11/25. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 17:00 on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road. 
No further rainfall is forecast. 
River levels at Pillings Lock Gauge will remain high until Wednesday afternoon on 19/11/25.
We are closely monitoring the situation .
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .
This message will be updated by 11:30 on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the afternoon of 17 November 2025 . 
Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible, especially in the Thrupp area. No further rainfall is forecast. We expect river levels to rise until tonight 17/11/25. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.message:
Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible on Tuesday 18 November 2025, especially in the Islip area. The forecast is for a predominantly dry day. Levels upstream of Islip are generally dropping, but slowly rising in the Islip area. Levels are expected to stabilise over the next day.

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 09:00 AM on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible on the evening of Monday 17 November 2025, especially areas closest to the River Thame and in the Thame and Stadhampton areas. The forecast is for a predominantly dry evening. Levels are expected to continue to slowly drop through the evening, but will remain above the flooding threshold over the coming days. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 09:00 AM on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Great Ouse in Cambridgeshire from Brampton to Earith
items.message: High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 17 November 2025. Areas most at risk are around the River Great Ouse from Brampton to Earith, including Back Brook, Hall Green Brook, Parsons Drove Drain, Swavesey Drain and Wadsbys Folly. Access to properties in Berry Lane, Godmanchester, may also be affected. The weather forecast is improving, and we expect levels to start returning to normal soon. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 18 November 2025, or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high and the potential for flooding continues today, 17 November 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: High tides and forecast weather conditions throughout today may lead to flooding. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  River levels will remain high over the next couple of days. Avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. We are closely monitoring the situation. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on Tuesday 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgley. Severn Ham, Tewkesbury starts to fill. Predicted peaks:- Mythe 4.1m to 4.2m on 17/11 AM, Haw Bridge 4.9m to 4.95m on 17/11 AM. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester
items.message: River levels are starting to fall however flooding is possible from 17 November 2025. We anticipate that this flood alert will remain in place until Tuesday evening, 18 November 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads around the River Dee at Shocklach, Farndon, Handley, Lower Kinnerton, Chester and Puddington. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels continue to rise as a result of widespread heavy rainfall last Friday. Flooding may continue over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Highley to Tewkesbury, including Dog Lane Bewdley, Stourport, Diglis & Hylton Road towpath. Flooded drains affect the racecourse & Worcester CCG. PLP should be installed. New St Gate is closed at Upton upon Severn. Predicted peaks: - Bewdley 3.9m to 4.2m on 18/11 AM, Worcester 4.6m to 4.7m on 18/11 AM, Diglis 4.5m to 4.6m on 18/11 AM, Kempsey Yacht Club 6.6m to 6.7m on 18/11 AM, Saxons Lode 4.9m to 5.0m on 19/11 AM. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels continue to rise as a result of widespread heavy rainfall last Friday. Flooding may continue over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and Squires Walk in the area of the Hatfield Brook Kempsey. Kempsey Flood Alleviation Scheme is operational. Predicted peak:- Kempsey Yacht Club 6.6m to 6.7m 18/11 AM. We are closely monitoring the situation.  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

This message will be updated by 8:00AM on 18th November 2025 or as the situation changes.

If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: River Severn at Hanley Road, Upton upon Severn
items.message:
Rising river levels are expected to cause flooding. Flooding is expected to continue over the next few days. 
Flooding may affect property and roads at Hanley Road, Upton upon Severn. Hanley Road may be closed.
Predicted peak:- Saxons Lode 4.9m to 5.0m on 19/11 AM. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and have closed flood gates. 
Please do not drive through floodwater as bow waves may affect adjacent properties and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: R Severn - Hanley Castle, Rectory Rd & Saxons Lode

We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Never drive through flood water, just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Severn Sandy Lane and Severnside, Stourport
items.message:
High river levels are expected to cause flooding overnight. 
Flooding is expected on 17 November 2025 and over the next few days. 
Flooding may affect properties along Severnside. Activate any property level resilience measures. Predicted peak:- Bewdley 3.9m to 4.2m on 18/11 AM. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary. Flood water is likely to continue to affect low lying land. 
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. For information on road closures due to flooding, Doncaster Council Website

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Goose Moor Lane at Ordsall, and farmlands in the Gamston and Eaton areas. 

No further rain is forecast, however river levels at the Mattersey gauge are continuing to rise. Levels will remain high until Tuesday, 18/11/25. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 17:00 on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Storm Claudia has caused heavy rainfall over the weekend. As a result river levels remain high, especially in the Short Ferry area, which may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible from 17 November 2025 .  Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties isn't likely and therefore flood warnings are not expected to be issued.  We are closely monitoring the situation .  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .  This message will be updated by 18 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Great Ouse from Thornborough to Newport Pagnell
items.message: High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 17 November 2025. Areas most at risk are those around the River Great Ouse from Thornborough to Newport Pagnell, including Dogsmouth Brook. The weather forecast is improving, and we expect levels to start returning to normal soon. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 18 November 2025, or as the situation changes.
